sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: System and information integr</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system: a. Generates error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited by adversaries; and b. Reveals error messages only to defined personnel or roles (defined in the applicable System Security Plan).  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  The information system reveals error messages only to authorized individuals with a need for the information in the performance of their duties.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="System and Information Integrity">aa873dfcdb211010280df36f299619f4</control_family> <control_name>Error Handling</control_name> <control_number>SI-11</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>SI-11</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards>Systems defined as CSPs:  High & Moderate:  CSP.1 - For CSPs, this Standard replaces the requirement defined within SI-11. The information system generates error messages that provide information </implementation_standards> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>false</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0011223</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:32</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>2</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>Code: 5 U.S.C. ยง552a(e)(5) and (10); FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; FISCAM: BP-1, BP-2, BP-3, BP-4, IN-1, IN-2; OMB Circular A-130: 7.g.; 45 C.F.R. ยง164.308(a)(3)(i)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AU-2, AU-3, SI-2</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Organizations carefully consider the structure/content of error messages. The extent to which information systems can identify and handle error conditions is guided by organizational policy and operational requirements. Information that could be exploited by adversaries includes, for example, erroneous logon attempts with passwords entered by mistake as the username, mission/business information that can be derived from (if not stated explicitly by) information recorded, and personal information such as account numbers, Social Security Numbers, and credit card numbers. In addition, error messages may provide a covert channel for transmitting information.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  An error in a system may reveal sensitive information such as personally identifiable information (PIIP or protected health information (PHI). For example, if there is an error posting a form that contains PII and the system includes the PII entered in the form when it writes to the error log, it will be visible to whoever has access permissions to the error log. Therefore, error handling must be considered in design of the system, and access to errors containing leaked sensitive information should be provided only to those individuals with a need for that information in the performance of their duties.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:32</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>32877dfcdb211010280df36f29961971</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:32</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
